Rumsfeld also faulted the administration for failing to work with Congress on drafting policies for treatment of prisoners. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, he wrote. The accounts of the book also quote Rumsfeld as criticizing his colleagues in the President Bush administration, including both of President Bush 's secretaries of state, Colin Powell and later Condoleezza Rice . universe.''[ 2] In that desire to vindicate comes an equal temptation to shape the events favorably, a desire that Donald Rumsfeld seems not to have escaped, as Fred Kaplan points out at Slate: Many autobiographies exhibit[ the tendency to self-aggrandizement] to some extent. It can even be tolerable if it's joined to an engaging style or sage insights about broader matters. Donald Rumsfeld 's book has no such redeeming features. And even if it did, its distortions and lies( I use the term advisedly) are just too blatant to be countenanced. Rebuttal, indeed.[ 1] G.W. De kans lijkt klein dat met het aanstellen van nieuwe topmanagers de aandeelhouders direct tevreden gesteld worden. Het kan wel de druk op Steve Ballmer wegnemen, maar alleen als het op korte termijn resultaat oplevert, aldus Wes Miller . UPDATE: Ondertussen zou ook oprichter Bill Gates het signaal afgeven dat hij Steve Ballmer niet langer zou steunen.
